9.question: The name saw-scale alludes to the saw-edged shaped scales

10.question: Russells viper are exceedingly fast and agile movers?
Russells viper bite leads to haematotoxic symptoms

11.question: The King cobra is the most venomous species found in India
King Cobras are widely distributed throughout the country
King cobras thrive in dry arid areas

12.question: All cobras have a spectacled mark
Cobra bites are usually associated with significant signs of local inflammation and necrosis at the bite site

13.question: Most krait bites are nocturnal events
Krait bite leads to significant local inflammation and necrosis

14.question: Hump nosed pit viper bites cause haemotoxicity
Does it causes significant local reaction and necrosis at the Hump nosed pit viper bite site?
The ASV available in India is effective against hump nosed pit viper

15.question: It is the commonest cause of death due to Malabar pit viper snakebite in Kerala
Bites of Malabar pit viper usually leads to swelling and inflammation without any systemic symptoms
Bites of Malabar pit viper leads to predominantly neurotoxic symptoms

16.question: Sea snakebite is a common cause of bite in Rajasthan
Myotoxicity is common with sea snakebite in humans
The anti-snake venom available in India is effective against sea snake venom
